p: In recent years, due to restrictions on the use of synthetic food additives and the constant increase in the survival capacity of detrimental microorganisms caused by resistance to antibiotics and preservatives, there has been an increase in the search for alternatives, such as natural antimicrobial compounds [ 4, 5]. In this sense, the effectiveness of the antimicrobial action of oils and extracts depends to a large extent on the chemical composition, which is related to the species and the parts of the plant that are used, the growing conditions, the harvest and the processing, as well as the method to obtain the extracts [ 2, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9].
